isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - ASSEMBLE

note.para: Steps 1 and 2 are for overdrive models only.

step1.para: Install the actuator arm over the pivot pin, and secure it with the snap ring ( Figure 92).

note.para: On overdrive models, if the direct/ overdrive yoke was not previously removed, install the oil trough and temporarily tie the yoke to the trough to prevent the yoke from falling toward the shift shaft and interfering with assembly.

step1.para: Position the housing with the bottom facing upward and the front of the housing (marked FRONT) toward you.

To aid assembly, lightly oil the inside of the shift yokes, overdrive shift block, shift shaft, detent key, shift key, and the inside of the shift shaft bores on the shift bar housing. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

Position the shift yokes (and actuator shift block for overdrive models) in the approximate position in the shift bar housing that they will be in when the shift shaft is installed. Make sure the yokes are installed with the word FRONT facing the front of the shift bar housing.

Install the detent key (it has rounded, protruding notches) from the front of the shift bar housing. Install the key with the word FRONT facing the front of the shift bar housing. To install the key, slide it down the left side of the shift shaft bore and through each shift yoke (and actuator shift block). One of the rectangular notches should fit in each yoke (and the shift block). The key fits between the front and rear bores of the shift bar housing. The three notches face away from the centerline of the bore ( Figure 93 and Figure 94).

caution.para: Do not hammer or force the shift shaft into position at step 7 or the shift bar housing components will be damaged. When all the components are in the proper positions, the shift shaft will slide in easily.

step1.para: Starting at the front of the shift bar housing, slide the shift shaft into position, making sure the bolt hole in the shift shaft faces downward. Use one hand to hold and position the detent key and yokes and the other to insert the shift shaft. The detent key fits in the groove on the shift shaft ( Figure 95).

note.para: Do not allow the detent key to slide rearward into the shift bar housing bore. It should butt against the boss.

figure.caption: Figure 95. Slide Shift Shaft into Position

step1.para: If necessary, reposition the shift shaft yokes (and actuator shift block) in the neutral position by aligning the detent key notches with the yokes (and actuator shift block).

From the rear of the shift bar housing, slide the shift key into the right-hand shift shaft groove. While sliding the key into place, align the key with the yokes (and actuator shift block) ( Figure 96).

note.para: Casting flash may need to be removed from the rear opening for the shift key.

step1.para: On the shift bar front, install the bias plate and snap ring. To properly install the bias plate and snap ring, the shift shaft or shift key may need to be pushed rearward ( Figure 97).

figure.caption: Figure 97. Install Bias Plate And Snap Ring

step1.para: Apply Loctite 242 or equivalent to the Allen head plug threads, and install the bias plunger, bias spring(s), and Allen head plug. Tighten the Allen head plug to 9.5 to 13. 6 Nm (84 to 120 in-lbs) ( Figure 98).

figure.caption: Figure 98. Install Allen Head Plug And Bias Plunger

step1.para: If previously removed, position the direct/overdrive shift yoke and yoke bar in the shift bar housing ( Figure 99).

figure.caption: Figure 99. Position Yoke and Yoke Bar in Shift Bar Housing

step1.para: Install the yoke bar roll pin, and drive it into place.
If previously removed, position the oil trough, and install the oil trough retaining bolts. Tighten the bolts to 27 to 31 Nm (20 to 23 ft-lbs).
Turn the shift bar housing over so the shift block can be installed.
Place the detent spring(s) and detent plunger in the shift block.
Place the shift block on the shift shaft using the following procedure:

step2.para: Tilt the shift block so the plunger faces slightly upward.
Place the plunger in the center of the detent notch, and press the plunger in to compress the spring(s).
While the spring(s) are compressed, roll the shift block into place on the shift shaft ( Figure 100)

note.para: The shift shaft and shift key may require repositioning to allow the shift block to fit into place.

figure.caption: Figure 100. Roll Shift Block Into Place

step1.para: Apply Loctite 242 or equivalent to the bolt. Install the shift block bolts. Tighten the bolt to 54 to 61 Nm (40 to 45 ft-lbs) ( Figure 101).
Install the reverse pin and switch, neutral pin and switch, breather, and air module.
